comments.body:
Even though the interface itself is deprecated, it's probably still worth it to deprecate the individual properties too. I imagine there could be scenarios where tooling may not alert that a deprecated type is being used but would on a deprecated property.

Also, the deprecations serve different purposes. The one on the type encourages users to use the more accurate `JQuery.Event` type and only has compile-time consequences. The ones on the properties are to notify about potential loss of support and has run-time consequences.
Good point! I pushed (https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/pull/31303/commits/9994b088c453af6c00db2df03f2de4ffa13a1975) a fix for that!
